title: Strawberry Shortcake
description: A light and fluffy cake layered with fresh strawberries and whipped cream.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9-inch cake pan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Gradually add the flour mixture alternating with milk, mixing until just incorporated.
Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool completely on a wire rack.
Mix sliced strawberries with 1/4 cup sugar and let sit for 15 minutes.
Slice cake in half horizontally, spread whipped cream on bottom layer, top with half the strawberries.
Place second cake layer on top, cover with remaining whipped cream and strawberries.

title: Pink Velvet Cupcakes
description: Delicate pink cupcakes with a light vanilla flavor and cream cheese frosting.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a cupcake pan with paper liners.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Add a few drops of pink food coloring until desired color is achieved.
Gradually add the flour mixture alternating with buttermilk, mixing until just incorporated.
Fill cupcake liners 2/3 full and bake for 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool completely on a wire rack.
For frosting, beat cream cheese and butter until smooth.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla, beat until creamy.
Pipe or spread frosting onto cooled cupcakes.

title: Red Velvet Cake
description: Classic red velvet cake with a rich cocoa flavor and cream cheese frosting.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease two 9-inch cake pans.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, and cocoa powder.
In a large bowl, beat oil, buttermilk, eggs, food coloring, vinegar, and vanilla.
Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix until smooth.
Divide batter between prepared pans and bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes, then remove to wire racks to cool completely.
For frosting, beat cream cheese and butter until smooth.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla, beat until creamy.
Frost between layers, then top and sides of cake.

title: Carrot Cake
description: Moist spiced cake filled with carrots and topped with cream cheese frosting.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9x13 inch pan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat oil and sugar until combined.
Add eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Fold in carrots and optional walnuts.
Gradually stir in flour mixture until just combined.
Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool completely on a wire rack.
For frosting, beat cream cheese and butter until smooth.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla, beat until creamy.
Spread frosting over cooled cake.

title: Macarons
description: Delicate French almond meringue cookies with a ganache filling.
ingredients: 3 large egg whites, at room temperature
instructions: Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a food processor, pulse powdered sugar and almond flour until fine, then sift.
In a large bowl, beat egg whites until foamy, then add cream of tartar.
Gradually add granulated sugar while beating until stiff peaks form.
Add food coloring if desired and mix until incorporated.
Gently fold in almond flour mixture in three additions.
Transfer mixture to a piping bag and pipe 1.5-inch rounds onto prepared sheets.
Tap sheets firmly on counter to release air bubbles.
Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes until a skin forms.
Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C) and bake for 15 minutes.
Cool completely on sheets before removing.
For ganache, heat cream until simmering, pour over chocolate, let stand 5 minutes, then stir until smooth.
Cool ganache until thickened, then sandwich between cookie pairs.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic chocolate chip cookies with a soft center and crisp edges.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream butter and both sugars until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Gradually add flour mixture and mix until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown around edges.
Cool on sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

title: Sugar Cookies
description: Soft, buttery sugar cookies that can be decorated with icing.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and baking powder.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg, vanilla, and buttermilk.
Gradually add flour mixture and mix until just combined.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls and roll in additional sugar.
Place on prepared sheets and flatten slightly with the bottom of a glass.
Bake for 8-10 minutes or until edges are golden.
Cool on sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

title: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
description: Chewy oatmeal cookies loaded with raisins and warm spices.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream butter and both sugars until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture and mix until just combined.
Stir in oats and raisins.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool on sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

title: Croissants
description: Flaky, buttery French pastries with a golden crust and soft interior.
ingredients: 1 egg beaten with 1 tbsp water (for egg wash)
instructions: In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, salt, and yeast.
Gradually add milk, mixing until a dough forms.
Knead briefly until smooth, then cover and chill for 1 hour.
On a floured surface, roll dough into a large rectangle.
Slice butter thinly and arrange on 2/3 of the dough.
Fold uncovered third over the middle third, then fold the remaining third on top.
Roll out again into a rectangle and repeat folding process.
Wrap in plastic and chill overnight.
Next day, roll dough into a large rectangle and cut into triangles.
Roll each triangle from base to tip, curving ends to form crescent shape.
Place on parchment-lined sheets, brush with egg wash.
Let rise until doubled, about 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and brush again with egg wash.
Bake for 18-20 minutes until golden brown.

title: Eclairs
description: Classic French pastry filled with vanilla custard and topped with chocolate.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium saucepan, bring water, butter, and salt to a boil.
Add flour all at once and stir vigorously until mixture forms a ball.
Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth and glossy.
Transfer to a piping bag and pipe 4-inch lines onto prepared sheets.
Bake for 30 minutes until golden and hollow sounding when tapped.
Cool completely on wire racks.
For custard, whisk milk, sugar, cornstarch, and egg yolks in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla, and cool completely.
For ganache, heat cream until simmering, pour over chocolate, let stand 5 minutes, then stir until smooth.
Cut eclairs in half lengthwise, fill with custard, and dip tops in ganache.

title: Danish
description: Sweet pastries with fruit or cheese filling and a flaky, buttery texture.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Gradually add milk and egg, mixing until a dough forms.
Knead briefly until smooth, then cover and chill for 1 hour.
On a floured surface, roll dough into a large rectangle.
Slice butter thinly and arrange on 2/3 of the dough.
Fold uncovered third over the middle third, then fold the remaining third on top.
Roll out again into a rectangle and repeat folding process.
Wrap in plastic and chill overnight.
For filling, beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
Next day, roll dough into a large square and cut into 12 squares.
Place a dollop of cream cheese filling and/or fruit preserve in center of each square.
Fold corners toward center, leaving center open to show filling.
Place on parchment-lined sheets and let rise until puffy, about 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and bake for 15 minutes until golden brown.

title: Apple Turnovers
description: Flaky pastry triangles filled with spiced apple filling.
ingredients: 1 large egg beaten with 1 tbsp water (for egg wash)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium saucepan, combine apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and lemon juice.
Cook over medium heat until apples begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Stir in cornstarch and cook until mixture thickens, about 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and cool completely.
Roll out puff pastry sheets and cut each into 4 squares.
Place a spoonful of apple filling in center of each square.
Brush edges with egg wash, then fold diagonally to form triangles.
Press edges with a fork to seal, then brush tops with egg wash.
Sprinkle with additional sugar and cut small vents in tops.
Bake for 18-20 minutes until golden brown and puffed.
Cool slightly on wire racks before serving.
